overview.headline: Four Service Areas. One Methodology.
overview.content: We help organizations translate process and data insights into measurable and governed value and improvement. Each service applies our disciplined approach: discovery that reveals reality, portfolios that prioritize value, and governance that ensures delivery.

services.title: Process Analytics & Continuous Improvement
services.tagline: Make process behavior visible. Build a repeatable improvement loop.
services.purpose: Establish a repeatable, data-driven improvement loop for business-critical processes.

context.headline: Typical Context
points: SAP-driven core processes (O2C, P2P, service, logistics, manufacturing)
Existing or planned use of process mining, Signavio, BI, or data platforms
Improvement initiatives driven by intuition rather than evidence

delivers.headline: What This Delivers
points: Clear visibility into actual process execution
Identified bottlenecks, rework, and structural inefficiencies
A prioritized improvement backlog (including automation and AI candidates)
Simple KPIs and monitoring for ongoing control

howItWorks.headline: How It Works
howItWorks.description: High-level approach to establishing process intelligence and continuous improvement:
steps: Extract and structure event data from SAP and surrounding systems
Analyze flows, variants, delays, and exceptions
Translate findings into concrete improvement initiatives
Set up a lightweight review cadence to track outcomes

value.headline: Value
points: Moves discussions from opinion to fact
Creates transparency for management and process owners
Enables continuous improvement beyond one-off analysis

tooling.headline: Tooling
tooling.tools: SAP Signavio, SAP Business Data Cloud, Databricks, BI tools, custom event analytics

services.title: SAP Modernization & Clean-Core Discovery
services.tagline: Reduce complexity. Safeguard your SAP investment. Enable innovation.
services.purpose: Support SAP transformations by reducing complexity and enabling future innovation without destabilizing the core.

context.headline: Typical Context
points: ECC or highly customized S/4HANA systems
Upcoming S/4HANA transformations or optimization phases
Difficulty upgrading or adopting new SAP innovations

delivers.headline: What This Delivers
points: Clear view of custom code, modifications, and process deviations using Plug and Gain analysis
Process House view with Best-Run Scores showing effectiveness of SAP processes
Pragmatic clean-core roadmap
Transaction analysis identifying harmonization opportunities and change management needs
Identification of extensions suited for SAP BTP or side-by-side architectures
Alignment between process design and system simplification

deliverables.headline: Tangible Deliverables
items: Process House with Best-Run Scores + transaction analysis
Custom code inventory (value-adding vs. technical debt)

howItWorks.headline: How It Works
howItWorks.description: Systematic approach combining breadth and depth of analysis to identify complexity and define a path to clean-core:
steps: Leverage SAP Signavio Plug and Gain approachâ€”combining Process Insights (breadth: KPIs, benchmarks, Best-Run Scores) with Process Intelligence (depth: process mining, variant analysis) to compress discovery from months to days
Analyze customizations, transaction code usage (standard vs. custom), and process variants across your SAP landscape
Distinguish value-adding complexity from technical debt using fact-based metrics
Define pragmatic clean-core roadmap: where standard SAP fits, where BTP extensions add value, and what to retire
Support ongoing governance to prevent re-customization

value.headline: Value
points: Lower long-term maintenance effort
Faster upgrades and innovation cycles
Cleaner integration with analytics and AI platforms

tooling.headline: Tooling
tooling.tools: SAP S/4HANA, SAP BTP, Signavio Process Insights & Process Intelligence (Plug and Gain), LeanIX, SAP Business Data Cloud, Databricks

services.title: Enterprise Architecture & Transformation Governance
services.tagline: Structure for complex programs. Clarity without bureaucracy.
services.purpose: Provide structure and clarity for complex transformation initiatives without slowing delivery.

context.headline: Typical Context
points: Large SAP or data platform programs
Multiple workstreams with unclear architectural alignment
EA practices that exist but are not operationally effective

delivers.headline: What This Delivers
points: Clear architecture principles and decision guardrails
Practical architecture governance integrated into delivery
Coherent target architectures and roadmaps
Support for architects, PMOs, and transformation leads

howItWorks.headline: How It Works
howItWorks.description: Pragmatic approach to establishing architecture governance that enables rather than blocks:
steps: Establish or stabilize architecture governance structures
Review key solution and integration designs
Ensure alignment between business goals, processes, and platforms
Support internal architects rather than replace them

value.headline: Value
points: Reduces architectural drift and rework
Improves decision transparency
Strengthens internal EA capability

tooling.headline: Tooling
tooling.tools: LeanIX, TOGAF-based methods, architecture repositories, standard collaboration tools

services.title: AI Governance & AI Agent Governance Foundations
services.tagline: Enable AI adoption with accountability and control.
services.purpose: Enable AI adoption while maintaining accountability, control, and trust.

context.headline: Typical Context
points: Growing number of AI or GenAI use cases
Concerns around risk, compliance, and uncontrolled automation
Introduction of autonomous or semi-autonomous AI agents

delivers.headline: What This Delivers
points: Clear AI governance principles and decision criteria
Defined ownership across the AI lifecycle
Integration of governance into data and ML platforms
Initial guardrails for AI agents and automation

deliverables.headline: Tangible Deliverables
items: AI governance charter (principles, roles, approval workflow)
Platform controls (MLflow, Unity Catalog, audit logs)

howItWorks.headline: How It Works
howItWorks.description: Lightweight, operational approach to establishing AI governance without blocking innovation:
steps: Assess current AI usage and risks
Define governance scope aligned with existing structures
Embed controls into ML and data platforms

value.headline: Value
points: Enables innovation without losing oversight
Reduces regulatory and reputational risk
Prepares the organization for increasing AI autonomy

tooling.headline: Tooling
tooling.tools: Databricks (MLflow, Unity Catalog), data platforms, existing risk and compliance frameworks
